properties.whats_the_plan: Push more gas to NYC by expanding the Athens compressor station, a facility along the pipeline route that boosts the flow of gas. This is one of four compressor stations the company seeks to expand.
properties.what_now: The Iroquois Pipeline Company was awarded a state air permit from New York's Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) on February 7, 2025 and given the green light to move forward with the project.

properties.location: 186 Dover Furnace Rd, Dover Plains, NY 12522
properties.whats_the_plan: Push more gas to NYC by expanding the Dover compressor station, a facility along the pipeline route that boost the flow of gas. This is one of four compressor stations the company seeks to expand.
properties.what_now: The Iroquois Pipeline Company was awarded a state air permit from New York's Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) on February 7, 2025 and given the green light to move forward with the project.

properties.whats_the_plan: Push more gas to NYC by expanding the Brookfield compressor station, a facility along the pipeline route that boost the flow of gas, to more than double its size. This is one of four compressor stations the company seeks to expand.
properties.what_now: The Iroquois Pipeline Company was awarded a state air permit from New York's Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) on February 7, 2025 and given the green light to move forward with the project.

properties.whats_the_plan: Push more gas to NYC by expanding the Milford compressor station, a facility along the pipeline route that boost the flow of gas. This is one of four compressor stations the company seeks to expand.
properties.what_now: The Iroquois Pipeline Company was awarded a state air permit from New York's Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) on February 7, 2025 and given the green light to move forward with the project.

properties.location: 960 Burnt Meadow Road, Township of West Milford, Passaic County, N.J
properties.whats_the_plan: Push more gas through to Westchester in New York by building a new compressor station, a facility along the pipeline route that boosts the flow of gas.
properties.what_now: In October of 2023, the New Jersey's Department of Environmental Conservation gave the Tenesse Pipeline Company the green light to move forward with the project despite a Superior Court ruling that it violated a law that protects the State's natural resources. The project's facility has been placed in service.

properties.location: 164 Libertyville Rd County Rte, Wantage Township, NJ 07461
properties.whats_the_plan: Push more gas through to Westchester in New York by trippling the size of an existing compressor station, which is a facility along the pipeline route that boosts the flow of gas.
properties.what_now: In October of 2023, the New Jersey's Department of Environmental Conservation gave the Tenesse Pipeline Company the green light to move forward with the project despite a Superior Court ruling that it violated a law that protects the State's natural resources. The project's facility has been placed in service.

properties.whats_the_plan: Push more gas through to Westchester in New York by upgrading the company's Pennsylvania based compressor station, which is a facility along the pipeline route that boosts the flow of gas.
properties.what_now: The project's facility has been placed in service, according to a December 2024 report issued by the Tennessee Gas Pipeline company to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC).

properties.whats_the_plan: To transform a peaker plant that only functioned during peak demand into a fullservice power plant.
properties.what_now: In 2021, the DEC denied an air permit the company needed to move forward with the plans, citing that the project was unable to "satisfy" elements of the State's Climate Act. Danskammer tried to overturn the decision with a series of lawsuits but in June the company withdrew their attempts to continute to defy the decision.

properties.operator: NRG - Astoria Gas Turbine Power, LLC
properties.whats_the_plan: Replace a 50-year-old high-polluting “peaker plant” with a more modern fracked gas facility.
properties.what_now: In 2021, DEC denied an air permit needed for the project and the company has not sought to overturn that. In its denial, the environmental agency said the project was unable to "satisfy" elements of the State's Climate Act.

properties.whats_the_plan: Transform an existing fracked gas peaker plant into a more modern and efficient power generating station in Sunset Park.
properties.what_now: Shortly after the State issued denials for the expansion of similar projects in Astoria and Gowanus, the company withdrew their proposal on December 15, 2021.

properties.whats_the_plan: Build the Williams Pipeline, a gas infrastructure project that would start in Pennsylvania, make its way through New Jersey and end in New York City’s Rockaways. It would have connected to the Rockaway Lateral, a pipeline that runs under Jacob Riis Park and Jamaica Bay
properties.what_now: After three attemts to get permits to build their pipeline, the company finally gave up and notified state authorities in May of 2024 that it would let a 2019 federal permit that green-lit the project expire and would not be seeking an extension.
